issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I tried to create an EBS image using the euca-import-instance command.  The import never finishes and stays in pending state.  This only appears to be happening on VPC clouds.
{code}
[root@d-41 ~]# euca-import-instance -t m1.small -f raw -a x86_64 -p Linux -b xenial-ebs-999 ./emis-ubuntu.B7JF4BuY/ubuntu-2016-05-04.raw --region 000491538740:admin@g-12-11.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
{code}
conversion status output:
{code}
Thu Jun  9 11:51:57 PDT 2016
TaskType        IMPORTINSTANCE  TaskId  import-i-7ebf0a40       ExpirationTime  Thu Jun 16 11:24:51 PDT 2016    Status  active  StatusMessage   Pending conversion
DISKIMAGE       DiskImageFormat RAW     DiskImageSize   2361393152      VolumeId        vol-fa906941    VolumeSize      3       AvailabilityZone        one     ApproximateBytesConverted  0       Status  active
{code}

fields.summary: euca-import-instance stays in 'Pending conversion' status in VPC cloud

comments.body: This cloud is running on CentOS6u7 in order to test nodeadmin-pack/unpack-instance.
[~ccassler], have you tried this after my commit this morning of the fix for EUCA-12279 ? It fixes an occasional hang when creating an EBS volume.
[~lincoln.thomas]...I upgraded the cloud today and still had this issue.

I was unable to reproduce this on a VPC cloud.

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.3.0
Release     : 0.24984.320.20160610git56f5d18.el7

{code}
